title-part.text: PHYSICAL THERAPY APPARATUS, e.g. DEVICES FOR LOCATING OR STIMULATING REFLEX POINTS IN THE BODY
BATHING DEVICES FOR SPECIAL THERAPEUTIC OR HYGIENIC PURPOSES OR SPECIFIC PARTS OF THE BODY

reference.text: electrotherapy, magnetotherapy, radiation therapy, ultrasound therapy A61N

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the following expression is used with the meaning indicated: "physical therapy" covers the treatment of disease or disability by means, e.g. mechanical means, as opposed to drugs or surgery. It includes, by way of example, massage, whirlpool baths or devices for exercising a passive body member.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: ; Chiropractic devices, e.g. body impacting devices, external devices for briefly extending or aligning unbroken bones

note.note-paragraph: This group does not cover orthopaedic methods or devices, which are covered by group A61F5/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Apparatus for applying movements to the whole body
Rocking or oscillating around a horizontal axis transversal to the body
Moveable platform, e.g. vibrating or oscillating platform for standing, sitting, laying, leaning
Apparatus for applying pressure or blows for compressive stressing of a part of the skeletal structure, e.g. for preventing or alleviating osteoporosis
Apparatus for applying pressure or blows almost perpendicular to the body or limb axis, e.g. chiropractic devices for repositioning vertebrae, correcting deformation

note.note-paragraph: In this group, documents which are of interest for more than one subgroup are classified in the hierarchically higher group only, unless there is a specific group for the combination

CPC-specific-text.text: Rotation of a body part around its longitudinal axis
Nutating movement of a body part around its articulation
Walking coordination of arms and legs

CPC-specific-text.text: Bathing devices specially adapted for treating burned patients
Arrangement for cleaning the installation before or after use
by blowing air through the installation after the bath has been emptied
by connecting the air lines with the drain
by draining-off pumps, nozzles, waterlines by gravity

with low-voltage switching, e.g. using optical isolators, isolated transformers
using remote control signal transmission devices, e.g. ultrasonic, infra-red
